light up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to give light to a place or to shine light on something
light up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The flames lit up the sky.
The fountain is lit up at night.
light up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to become bright with light or colour
light up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: At night the harbour lights up.
As the screen lit up, he typed in his password.
light up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if someone’s face or eyes light up, they show pleasure, excitement etc
light up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: His eyes lit up with laughter.
Her face lit up with pleasure.
light up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to make someone’s face or eyes show pleasure or excitement
light up.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Suddenly a smile lit up her face.
A mischievous gleam lit up her eyes.
light up.translation[0].definitions[4].e: I watched Paul light up again.
